item.title: Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater adds online battle mode ‘Fox Hunt’
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/metal-gear-solid-delta-snake-eater-adds-online-battle-mode-fox-hunt

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Xbox Series version includes "Snake vs. Bomberman" minigame.

Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater will feature an online battle mode called “Fox Hunt,” Konami announced.

“Fox Hunt is a completely original online battle mode,” mode director Yu Sahara said in today’s Konami Press Start broadcast. “Although it shares the same worldview of Metal Gear Solid Delta, the gameplay is completely different. Perhaps many people will think of Metal Gear Online when hearing about a Metal Gear Online battle mode, but Fox Hunt is different from Metal Gear Online.

“Thankfully, there were requests to bring back Metal Gear Online from players who played Metal Gear Online back in the day. On the other hand, the environment surrounding players has changed drastically since those days. We carefully considered what kind of online battle mode we should create now under today’s circumstances.

“Based on the ‘stealth‘ of the Metal Gear series—especially ‘camouflage,’ which is a feature of the main story of this game, and the element of ‘survival,’ which is the theme of this game—not only focusing on simply shooting at each other, but taking advantage of ‘hide and seek’ and ‘discovering’—building a concept of ‘online battles unique to Metal Gear‘ was a new challenge.

“Unfortunately, we are not yet able to explain the specifics of the game this time, but we are working on Fox Hunt diligently. We hope to have more specific information about the game as it develops.”

Konami also confirmed that while the PlayStation 5 and PC versions of Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater will feature the “Snake vs. Monkey” minigame with characters from Ape Escape, the Xbox Series version will feature the “Snake vs. Bomberman” minigame.

Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on August 28.

Watch the Xbox Series version of the recent gameplay trailer below, featuring footage of “Snake vs. Bomberman.”

item.title: Suikoden STAR LEAP adds PC version
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/suikoden-star-leap-adds-pc-version

  • PC

Free-to-play strategy RPG no longer limited to mobile.

Free-to-play strategy RPG Suikoden STAR LEAP will be available for PC via Steam alongside its previously announced iOS and Android versions, Konami announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

New 108 stars, a new tale of runes—Suikoden STAR LEAP is an entirely new addition to Konami’s most popular RPG series. A new story with 108 new stars, unfolding in the same world and history as the series, can be enjoyed with beautiful graphics and powerful sound.

Introduction

The Rune of Change is one of the 27 True Runes that are said to have created the world.

Solar Year 453. Tragedy strikes a lakeside village located east to the Scarlet Moon Empire, where mysterious enemies attack, houses go up in flames, and people have to flee for their lives.

After the threat leaves, the Hero, along with Hisui, Shirin, and Shapur stand up to restore the village.

As the Hero and his friends depart for their journey, they quickly get caught up in the great swells of history.

What are the atrocities that torment the people of the Empire?

What kind of destiny will these encounters with Viktor, Flik, Odessa, and various others lead to?

Small adventures eventually turn into a large ambition.

For our precious one.

Key Features

  • A story spun through encounters with 108 stars and many other characters as it travels around the world.
  • Profound dots for location and character expression.
  • Battle strategies and experiences that expand as many as the number of characters.

Main character design

Moryo

*Various illustrators are scheduled to create illustrations in the future.

Character Voices by a Splendid Voice Cast

  • Hero (voiced by Tomohiro Ono)
  • Hisui (voiced by Hika Tsukishiro)
  • Hou (voiced by Akio Otsuka)
  • Shirin (voiced by Fairouz Ai)
  • Shapur (voiced by Takuya Sato)
  • Yua (voiced by Liyuu)
  • Orhan (voiced by Kazuhiko Inoue)
  • Farah (voiced by Miho Wataya)
  • Flanagan (voiced by Kengo Takanashi)
  • Stendhal (voiced by Inuko Inuyama)
  • Odessa (voiced by Haruka Shiraishi)
  • Flik (voiced by Yuichi Nakamura)
  • Viktor (voiced by Katsuyuki Konishi)

item.title: EDENS ZERO demo now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/edens-zero-demo-now-available

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Carry over your save data to the full game when it launches.

A demo for 3D action RPG EDENS ZERO is now available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store, Konami announced. Save data from the demo can be carried over to the full game when it launches.

Here is an overview of the demo, via Konami:

About

This is a trial version, where you can experience the EDENS ZERO game’s opening.

*You can use your save data from the trial version to continue from where you left off in the final game.
*Trophies/Achievements cannot be obtained in the trial version.

This is a 3D action role-playing game based on the space fantasy comic / anime EDENS ZERO by Hiro Mashima, the creator of Fairy Tail and Rave Master. It is centered on Shiki Granbell and his friends’ cosmos-spanning adventure.

Hiro Mashima and Kodansha have had input throughout the game’s production!

The player controls a diverse cast of characters as they embark on an epic adventure across different planets while battling powerful enemies!

Relive the Original Story with 3D Graphics That Look Just Like the Anime!

The game is brought to life with anime-style 3D graphics, replicating the beautiful characters and worlds of EDENS ZERO.

The player can freely explore various planets and enjoy numerous cutscenes voiced by a stellar cast.

Re-experience the thrilling emotional rollercoaster of the original story!

Countless Character Customization Options!

You can customize both your characters’ stats and their appearance to your exact liking! Tinker with your favorite character until you get them looking and fighting just right for you!

As you advance through the game, your collection of equipment will continue to grow. In addition to stats and appearances, you can also progress through the Skill Tree for each character, enhancing and diversifying the action itself!

EDENS ZERO is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on July 15.

Switch 2 opens at 947,931 units sold, Mario Kart World at 782,566 units.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for week of June 2, 2025 to June 8, 2025.

Mario Kart World for Switch 2 was the highest selling new release of the week, opening at 782,566 retail copies sold. Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma for Switch followed at 45,703 retail sales, with the Switch 2 version selling an additional 10,877 units. The Switch 2 version was the second highest selling system launch title.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 debuted at 947,931 units, surpassing the original Switch’s 329,152 sold (as per Media Create) at launch. The PlayStation 5 family sold 20,782 units, the Switch family sold 16,611 units, the Xbox Series family sold 333 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 24 units.

item.title: Still Wakes the Deep story DLC ‘Siren’s Rest’ announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/still-wakes-the-deep-story-dlc-sirens-rest-announced

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Due out on June 18 for $12.99.

Publisher Secret Mode and developer The Chinese Room have announced Still Wakes the Deep paid story downloadable content “Siren’s Rest.” It will launch on June 18 for $12.99 / £9.99 / €12.99, with a 15 percent-off launch discount available for PC via Steam.

The expansion will offer around 1.5 to two hours of additional playtime, and takes players back to the site of the Beira D, a decade after the events of the main story.

Here is an overview of the content, via Secret Mode:

1986. The Beira D is now a groaning steel catacomb interred in the inky depths of the North Sea. What really happened that December day in 1975, when communications to the mainland were severed and the rig sank without a trace? What answers can be given to families who still grieve, ten years on?

You are Mhairi. And you will find those answers. As the leader of a saturation dive to the wreck of the Beira D, you descend, a fragile light in the crushing dark. Your mission: uncover the fate of the crew and recover what remains of their passing.
